, IndiaJob Family Group:Worker Type:Posting Start Date:Business unit:Experience Level:Job Description:If you are an operations expert with a passion for operating on a global scale, looking to get a good deal of exposure to database management and database security concepts, develop a good understanding of compliance and thrive under pressure, this could be your chance to make your mark in the energy industry in the Data Platform’s area.Where you fit in
As we transition to cleaner forms of energy, the challenge facing the energy industry in the coming decades is considerable. IT specialists are vital to how we leverage and deliver global digital solutions. You’re going to be a key part of the Integrated Gas, Upstream and Projects & Technology (IGU-PT SOM) ASSET & SE Service & Operations Management (SOM) team. This team delivers secure, reliable, and affordable E2E IT operations to the IGU-PT business. As IT professionals with a business lens our focus is to unlock value and accelerate Shell’s journey in energy transition. With the team having been forged from two separate teams as part of Reshape, One Team mindset will be a key part our culture.
 What’s the role
 You are responsible for safeguarding the business data in the databases and delivery of database support. You serve as a database expert consultant to provide database technology solutions meeting business and application needs.  Manage and maintain databases, including database replication, disaster recovery and backups strategy.  Participate in disaster recovery planning and testing.
Develop and Implement standards and best practices for database administration.
Implement and monitor database health and performance monitoring, sizing estimation, growth planning, usage monitoring to ensure high levels of performance, availability, sustainability, and security.
Establish and maintain performance baselines, troubleshoot performance issues, and provide recommendations, undertake root cause analysis, and deploy permanent fixes.
Assist developers and operations support teams with query tuning, schema refinement, architecture review, modelling, and design support.
Implement and operate database maintenance schedule and support release deployment activities ensuring minimal business interruption.
Promote and implement Continuous Improvement, automation and evergreening of database landscape components.
Responsible for ensuring the application portfolio is compliant with the relevant IT controls and information security standards & baselines.What we need from youBachelor’s degree related to IT and at least 10 years of experience working in an operations team role closely related to the objectives described in this job pack.
Experience in working in a global implementation/support of in house and off the shelf application.
Broad understanding of complex and integrated application/infrastructure, process, governance, and supplier landscape is preferred.
Proven hands-on working experience as a Database Administrator (MS SQL, Azure SQL, Oracle)
Excellent knowledge of database performance monitoring and tuning, data backup, recovery, security, and integrity.
Familiarity with database design, data modelling, documentation, and coding.
Knowledge of middleware services like BODS, SSIS, MII PCO.
Hands-on experience with Azure Stack (Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Services, Stream Analytics, Data bricks, Azure SQL etc) and various reporting technology like SAP BO, Spotfire, MS Power BI etc.
ITIL working knowledge (Incident, Change, Problem, Release and Request Management)
Virtual working in a global environment with culturally diverse teams, multiple delivery priorities and multiple demand requests.-COMPANY DESCRIPTIONAn innovative place to workThere’s never been a more exciting time to work at Shell.
